{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3557894,"name":"Landon","username":"Lfehr","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/l/47e85d/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-15T22:33:57.484Z","cooked":"

@nstrike
My team’s odometry in swerve drifts in an unpredictable way where the x axis only drifts we have MK4 L2 swerve with a frame of 33x 26.75. It is not the deadband it is not, that the gyro is inverted. What are your suggestions. Here is my team’s code. Also we tried it without vision and it drifted worse.

github.com

GitHub - 7657thunderbots/FRC2025-REEFSCAPE

Contribute to 7657thunderbots/FRC2025-REEFSCAPE development by creating an account on GitHub.

Any suggestions it is visible when we run our pathing on the fly and just less than 10 seconds of regular driving it will drift about 5 inches

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-03-15T22:33:57.484Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":17,"reads":91,"readers_count":90,"score":103.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":495716,"topic_slug":"yagsl-swerve-drive-drift","display_username":"Landon","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/7657thunderbots/FRC2025-REEFSCAPE/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub - 7657thunderbots/FRC2025-REEFSCAPE","clicks":4}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53962,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/yagsl-swerve-drive-drift/495716/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3557898,"name":"Chris","username":"Chris_7898","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chris_7898/{size}/226133_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-15T22:39:49.656Z","cooked":"

I believe this is from PID’s or your wheels slipping when auton starts. to counter this you can either increase your accel time or you could also add a little “I” to the PID

When auto starts and it initializes the position it doesn’t drift. When we run our auto alone command for about 2 times it stays within an inch tolerance but around 3+times in teleop is when it starts to drift
Also we already tried adjusting those

Do you have auto correction turned on in the YAGSL swerveinputstream (it may not be in there but make sure that’s set to false)

How do I go about that would that be set chassis discretization to false?
Also I found something odd that may cause telemetry to be thrown off with vision is that the camera offset in the sim x and y are flipped for some reason

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-03-16T03:30:54.439Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":46,"readers_count":45,"score":14.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":495716,"topic_slug":"yagsl-swerve-drive-drift","display_username":"Landon","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":60542,"username":"Chris_7898","name":"Chris","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chris_7898/{size}/226133_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53962,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/yagsl-swerve-drive-drift/495716/5","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3558199,"name":"Chris","username":"Chris_7898","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chris_7898/{size}/226133_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-16T12:09:33.458Z","cooked":"

You want to set this to false. SwerveSubsystem.Java Line 127.

swerveDrive.setHeadingCorrection(true); - set to false
","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-03-16T12:09:33.458Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":44,"readers_count":43,"score":13.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":495716,"topic_slug":"yagsl-swerve-drive-drift","display_username":"Chris","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":53962,"username":"Lfehr","name":"Landon","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/l/47e85d/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60542,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5561 programming"},"post_url":"/t/yagsl-swerve-drive-drift/495716/6","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3558205,"name":"Chris","username":"Chris_7898","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chris_7898/{size}/226133_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-16T12:22:20.175Z","cooked":"

Also, explain why you should do this. I was playing around with this to see if it would correct our drift from not having tuned PIDs, but it multiplied the issue and caused us to have even more drift.

Removing that didn’t fix the translational drift and setting it to false didn’t fix it. It is translational drift not rotational

Oh…

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-03-17T12:59:47.744Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":24,"readers_count":23,"score":4.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":495716,"topic_slug":"yagsl-swerve-drive-drift","display_username":"Chris","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":53962,"username":"Lfehr","name":"Landon","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/l/47e85d/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60542,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5561 programming"},"post_url":"/t/yagsl-swerve-drive-drift/495716/9","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3559155,"name":"","username":"nstrike","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-17T13:03:31.699Z","cooked":"

Your back left and front left drive motors are inverted. Usually this means you had the wrong module locations specified. I would encourage you to spin in place and watch the modules. Some may be going backwards or facing the wrong direction. As a general rule of thumb your module files are almost always nearly identical. So and deviations should be reflected in hardware choices.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-03-17T13:03:31.699Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":24,"readers_count":23,"score":9.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":495716,"topic_slug":"yagsl-swerve-drive-drift","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51887,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"YAGSL Creator & Maintainer"},"post_url":"/t/yagsl-swerve-drive-drift/495716/10","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3559189,"name":"Landon","username":"Lfehr","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/l/47e85d/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-17T13:46:59.964Z","cooked":"

Last year we didn’t have this problem, but we had a square frame. This year our frame is 33 X 26.75 could this cause problems having a rectangle frame (we adjusted the offsets to match the new dimensions.)

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-03-17T13:46:59.964Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":15,"readers_count":14,"score":8.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":495716,"topic_slug":"yagsl-swerve-drive-drift","display_username":"Landon","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":51887,"username":"nstrike","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53962,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/yagsl-swerve-drive-drift/495716/11","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3559214,"name":"","username":"nstrike","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-17T14:04:10.502Z","cooked":"

Not likely. I think you just have your modules in the wrong locations. If you spin in place it will probably have 2 spin the wrong way. Then if you drive forward. They will spin correctly

Would subtracting 180 from those two absolute encoders fix the drive needing to be inverted?

Yes, but it could cause other problems. Please post a video of your swerve drive going straight then spinning inplace.

I subtracted 180 from it and it works as expected but I can’t test till later tonight if the drift still exists because the swerve modules are not bolted in due to other work and i was not able get a video.
